meanings.definition: A strong forward movement or flow
meanings.sent1: The onrush of water from the burst pipe flooded the basement.
meanings.sent2: The onrush of students exiting the school at the end of the day was overwhelming.
meanings.sent3: The onrush of puppies running towards their owner was a heartwarming sight.
meanings.sent4: The onrush of emotions during the surprise party left her speechless.
meanings.sent5: The onrush of wind through the open window made the curtains billow dramatically.

meanings.sent1: The onrush of thunder and lightning signaled the start of the storm.
meanings.sent2: The onrush of pain after stubbing my toe was intense.
meanings.sent3: The onrush of giggles during the serious meeting caught everyone off guard.
meanings.sent4: The onrush of memories flooded her mind when she saw the old photograph.
meanings.sent5: The onrush of panic set in as the deadline approached.
